explanation: The loop header 'for i in range(n):' was wrong. When i gets near n, accessing s[l+i] for l in 0..6 causes an IndexError because it reads past the end of the list. The fix is to iterate only over valid starting indices for 7-element windows: range(n-6). That ensures l+i never exceeds the last index.
fixed_code:
n = int(input())
s = list(map(int,input().split()))

for i in range(n-6):
  ans = 0
  for l in range(7):
    ans += s[l+i]

  print(str(ans),"",end = "")
